title: Ielts speaking part1
content:
Name

Does your name have any special meaning ?

  • what：Definitely, almost every name in China has a special meaning.

  • My name can be interpreted as stock because my grandma wants me to be tough or firm like stocks she passed away 10 years ago and I missed her so much because she is a .. woman and I leart a lot from her

  1. How would you choose names for your next generation ?

    • Firstly, I would ask my families about naming traditions[命名传统].
    • My family has common middle names[通用的中间名] for each generation
    • I think I would consult[查询] some online name database coz choosing a name for my baby has a lifelong impact so I would be really cautious.

  2. Are there any differences between how Chinese name their children now and in the past ?

    • Well, in the past， I mean, in my parents‘ or grandparents’ generation, people like to give their children names that reflect ethical and moral sense[道德意义] such as Zhong[忠] which literally[字面的] means loyalty, or De[德] which means virtue or some given names just commemorate some important events such as Jianguo, which means establishing a country， was used by babies born during the year that Modern China was found.
    • But today young parents especially like to directly use celebrities’ names or names from their favorite movies or novels.
